thread.title: Judge invalidates rule against mountain protests
thread.title_full: Judge invalidates rule against mountain protests

title: Judge invalidates rule against mountain protests
text: Judge invalidates rule against mountain protests Updated 1:52 am, Saturday, October 10, 2015 HONOLULU (AP) â€” The Honolulu Star Advertiser reports ( http://bit.ly/1QfygzX) that a judge has issued a decision invalidating the state's emergency rule aimed at curbing protests against the construction of the Thirty Meter Telescope atop the Big Island mountain of Mauna Kea. The newspaper says the Hawaii circuit court granted a partial motion for summary judgment, according to a joint statement issued late Friday by state Attorney General Douglas Chin and state Board of Land and Natural Resources Chairwoman Suzanne Case . The state land board approved the emergency rule after a heated July 10 public meeting. The rule prohibited being within a mile of the Mauna Kea access road between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m., unless in a moving vehicle. The rule also prohibited, at any time, sleeping bags, camping stoves, tens and propane burners on the mountain.
